title: Manchester United legend Paul Scholes admits he based his game on Real Madrid superstar | Metro News
text:
Sean Kearns for Metro.co.uk Thursday 16 Feb 2017 11:03 am Paul Scholes is keen on Manchester United signing (Picture: Getty) 
Manchester United legend Paul Scholes admits he based his game on Real Madrid midfielder Toni Kroos during the latter stages of his career. 
Scholes, 42, retired in 2013 after 20 years and 499 appearances for the Red Devils. ‘How can Gibbs be captain?!’ Man Utd legend Roy Keane TEARS into Arsenal flops 
Sir Alex Ferguson’s successor, David Moyes, was keen on signing Kroos as a replacement for Scholes in 2014 but he was sacked after just ten months at the Theatre of Dreams and Louis van Gaal pulled out of a deal for the Bayern Munich ace. 
Kroos has gone on to establish himself as one of the best midfielders in the world at the Bernabeu and Scholes has admitted he started to base his game on the German after watching him at Bayern. Kroos joined Real Madrid in 2014 (Picture: Getty) 
‘Kroos is the best midfield passer in the world,’ Scholes told Kicker. 
‘Towards the end of my career, I tried to emulate him. 
‘Kroos would be a perfect fit alongside [Ander] Herrera and [Paul] Pogba at Manchester United.’
